page.title: 11WATER SUPPLY ON A FARM
page.content: We visited a farm in our area. It has approximately 400 acres of farmland .This requires a constant supply of water,which is extracted from the River Teise.The water is extracted along a system of pipes,which is powered by 2, 100 horse power engines.These are manually operated.The level of water is controlled by an automatically operated sluice gate.Any rubbish such as leaves,crisp packets etc. are filtered from the water by a wire gauze film.The water is then pumped through another system of pipes leading to a standpipe,from where the water can be used.There are also other pipes leading to an apple orchard within the farm.The water is then pumped up a vertical pipe which sprays the orchard.Some farms in the area received grants for reservoirs.
